N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 297.6 - Office of general services responsibilities

State Regulations
(a) The Office of General Services shall
provide space and power for the installation of the telecommunications
equipment if, in the judgment of the Commissioner of General Services, such
installations can be accommodated. (b) Every effort will be made by the

Commissioner of General Services to ensure compatibility of systems operation
and maximum utilization of all space, power, antenna support structures and
transmission line conduits. No major modifications of antenna support
structures and transmission line conduits to accommodate additional systems, which modifications would result in any additional money obligation to existing
users, will be undertaken without prior notification. Each user shall have the
option of removing his equipment in the event that he does not wish to be
assessed for a shared cost of the modification. (c) The Office of General Services does not
guarantee system compatibility, nor does it assume any responsibility for
proper operation of any system installed, or damage resulting from actions or
operations of others. Any agreement providing for the installation of
telecommunications facilities shall contain a covenant by the user to hold
harmless and indemnify the State of New York, its officers and employees, against all claims and liability arising from actions or omissions of the user, its agents or employees, on the State's premises and from actions of third
parties with relation to property of the user and all action taken by the user
on the State's premises under the agreement. Notes
